title: Senior Automation Test Engineer C++
description:
Luxoft is a leading global software services company, delivering professional services across multiple business verticals such as finance, automotive, and digital transformation. The Automotive practice inside DXC Luxoft delivers SW projects to a majority of the world's car manufacturers and suppliers for both personal and commercial vehicles. We are known for our Automotive SW expertise and for helping our customers with high quality services and deliveries. Currently we are growing for our Swedish customers and are looking for Software Developers to join our team. You will be part of our growing organization in Sweden and will be part of developing next gen systems for the Automotive industry for the age of connected, autonomous, electric vehicles. Participate in the process of test system flow by defining test activities, equipment, asset under test and DUT (Device Under Test) preparedness together with requirement owner and suppliers..
Responsibilities:
As a senior Test Automation Engineer at Luxoft you will be responsible for:
‚Ä¢ The ECU component verification, i.e. black and white box test, acceptance test and regression test on deliverables from supplier (both inhouse and external).
‚Ä¢ Automation of test cases in vTestStudio for Component-/Domain- and Complete testing in bench rig, HIL and on Vehicle. Test Cases to automate are from all functional areas.
‚Ä¢ Creating and maintain automation test framework in Python.
‚Ä¢ Testing methods & test case development, planning and coordination of test activities together with rest of the team. ‚Ä¢ Creating Fault reports and assign to receivers to investigate and create solutions.
‚Ä¢ Reviewing and communicating with suppliers' the test reports and results.
‚Ä¢ Independently take logs and measurement on the component and actuators and signals.
‚Ä¢ In collaboration with developer analyze logs to identify root cause of faults.
‚Ä¢ Ensuring the work is delivered as per specified acceptance criteria and definition.
‚Ä¢ Reading and analyzing from HIL's or other test set-ups.
‚Ä¢ Empowering close collaboration with team members within team and other teams.
‚Ä¢ Being self-organized and outspoken to support the team creating the best solutions.
Mandatory Skills Description:
‚Ä¢ Bachelor's or Master's degree in Engineering or equivalent education.
‚Ä¢ At least 8 years of experience from manual and automated verification of automotive embedded software.
‚Ä¢ Programming knowledge in Python and exposure to C++.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge and understanding how to read electrical schematics, use of instruments such as voltmeters and oscilloscopes.
‚Ä¢ Experiences of the following tools is preferred: Requirement management tool, Vektor tools like Canalyzer/Canoe (both Hardware and software), Inca and DSA.
‚Ä¢ Fluent in English.
‚Ä¢ European B-driver license.
Nice-to-Have Skills:
‚Ä¢ HIL sanity test automation in CANoe (CAPL) or Robot Framework.
‚Ä¢ Vector tools knowledge. ‚Ä¢ DSPACE tools knowledge.
‚Ä¢ JavaScript expert competence.
‚Ä¢ Docker.
‚Ä¢ Ansible.
‚Ä¢ Git, Gerrit, Artifactory.
‚Ä¢ CI/CD mindset.
‚Ä¢ Passion for new technologies, software and hardware test and creating great user experiences.
‚Ä¢ Willing to take up the task that is most important for the team to progress.
http://www.luxoft.com

title: Senior Software / Networks / Devops / Cybersecurity Engineer
description:
Hurricane in the Bahamas, a flooding in Germany, forest fire in V√§rmland or an important interview in a refugee camp in Syria. The telecommunication infrastructure is vulnerable to natural disasters, governmental intervention or simply limited due to inadequate coverage. This is where Satcube comes in to enable doctors, journalists and first response to establish a satellite internet connection in under a minute.
Satcube's goal is to provide highly portable satellite communication devices that can be used by anyone, anywhere. In order to make our products and service offerings even easier to use we are looking for an experienced engineer¬†to join us.
What is the job about?As an engineer in our managed service team¬†you‚Äôll be working with development of our subscription services for¬†critical communications services.¬†
We are looking for the right person to fit our team and our development plans forward. The team is recruiting to expand broadly and with an engineer with a breadth of abilities but that primarily can fit well into the team. Therefore, we are looking for someone who can work in multiple of¬†the following domains:
 Networking SD-WAN
 Fiber
 DNS
 IPsec
 
 Virtualisation Kubernetes
 Proxmox
 
 Engineering for¬†Critical services¬†
 Software applications (Python & Rust)
 GitOps
 Software & Networks operations
 Databases Relational
 Time-series
 Victoria Metrics

 Process implemenation
 
 Nobody knows everything in depth, but you should have an edge in at least one of the domains listed above.¬†In this role you‚Äôll be responsible for: Architecture
 Design for robustness
 Design with a cybersecurity mindset
 Delivery
 Contribute to the planning and prioritization of work
 Why work with us?
We value our coworkers! At Satcube we offer max 'friskv√•rdsbidrag', private health insurance, maxed out sick insurance and better pensions than standard.
 Be part of a fast-growing company in the space industry.
 Whilst working in a team you‚Äôll be getting responsibility from day one.
 Work with clients all over the world to solve their connectivity needs.
 An opportunity to shape your work environment and how we¬†develop technically.
 Who should apply?
Someone who also wants to make communication easy!
 Required experience:A relevant bachelor or master's degree.
 5 years previous experience.
 A team¬†player.
 Questions?
All applications are considered in an ongoing manner, meaning that the position could be filled before the set deadline. If you have any questions regarding the position, please don‚Äôt hesitate to reach out. We are looking forward to hearing from you!
Who we areSatcube AB is a scaleup working in the SATCOM industry, based in Gothenburg and with production in Karlstad. Consisting of a small but helpful and kind team that is revolutionizing the satellite communications industry. The core of the company is our lightweight satellite terminals, capable of providing high speed internet to any location on earth. This is done by sending radio waves 36000 km into space, aimed at a satellite that is only a couple of meters wide, before retransmitting the signal back down. Our advanced terminal then interprets this signal - an internet connection has been established!
Join us in ending the communication gap during crises and in remote locations!

title: Senior Developer to Relay Software Team
description:
About Us 
Mullvad VPN is a Swedish VPN company dedicated to fighting mass surveillance and censorship. We do this primarily through our VPN service and our web browser.
We believe in a free and open society where people have the right to personal privacy; the right to their own thoughts and opinions, and the right to decide exactly when and with whom they want to share them.
We believe that privacy is the right which all other rights rest upon, and that democratic societies must be built on the right to privacy in order to thrive and develop.
The Job
We‚Äôre looking for a Senior Developer to join our Relay Software Team at Mullvad. This team is responsible for all custom software solutions¬†used on our VPN relays.¬†
You‚Äôll play a key role in advancing server support for technologies such as Quantum-secure tunnels, traffic-analysis protection and protocol obfuscation. 
Who Are You
You‚Äôre someone who enjoys working in a team, contributes ideas proactively, and has a strong interest in security, networks and low-level software development.¬†
You value quality, maintainability, and thoughtful software design. You are curious and eager to learn, and you understand the importance of digital privacy.
Responsibilities Work on new and exciting technologies and greenfield projects.
 Using Go, design and implement robust server software for running on Linux.
 Author clean solutions that balance performance and resource usage.
 Perform measurements,¬†testing and troubleshooting.
 Coordinate with stakeholders and¬†developers in other departments.
 Qualifications Excellent written and spoken English and Swedish.
 Highly developed understanding of software design and all aspects of software implementation.
 Experience with building server software.
 Excellent understanding of networking fundamentals.
 Strong knowledge in at least one of C/Go/Rust.
 Why Mullvad?
We are a bunch of diversified peeps: from vegans to marathon runners, audiophiles to farmers and coffee brewers. So, what unites us? Our commitment to living and breathing our mission, to make mass surveillance and censorship impractical.¬†
Additional Information
Location: Gothenburg, Sweden Start: As soon as possible Job Hours: Full-time
This is an ongoing recruitment process and we aim to fill the position as soon as possible. As part of our hiring process, we conduct a background check to ensure a safe and secure work environment.

Your work will directly impact the performance and robustness of real-world AI systems‚Äîfrom self-driving cars to defense robotics.

title: Senior DevOps Engineer
description:
About this role 
We are now looking for a Senior DevOps Engineer for our organization, someone with a deep interest in infrastructure and enabling fast feedback loops for developers by developing continuous integration capabilities. You will belong to a small and passionate team responsible for developing our infrastructure and related technology stack for on premise and cloud deployments; the foundation for our video analytics platform that thousands of cameras across the world are connected to. 
Some of the technologies we use: 
 Go and C++ 
  Kubernetes, OpenShift and Docker 
  Kafka, Redis, MongoDB and Postgres 
  Elastic and Grafana 
  Git, CircleCI and ArgoCD 
 
Our company culture is based on freedom and responsibility. For us that means you will be given extensive freedom to make strategic technical decisions while meeting our ambitious standards and making decisions in a responsible way. You will be located at our headquarters in Gothenburg where we are a team with a lot of positive energy and a strong sense of community. 
Who we think you are 
To be successful in this role, we expect you will bring experience of working with product development and/or solutions that leverage physical or cloud infrastructure. Experience with on premise deployments is a plus. You also need a good understanding of organizational aspects of software development and of how to collaborate efficiently with others. 
Requirements 
 At least 4 years of experience working with infrastructure and tooling for applications with high performance requirements. 
  Strong knowledge of multiple of the technologies we use, e.g., OpenShift, Kubernetes, databases and messaging systems. Kubernetes administrator certificate is a plus. 
  Linux administrator knowledge, e.g., knowledge in kernels, different distributions etc. 
  General interest and knowledge in security. 
  A strong desire to collaborate with others and to contribute to team success. 
  Great understanding of both Windows and Linux build environments and toolchains. 
  Excellent communication and organization skills and great personal initiative and drive, with an ability to understand the requirements of different stakeholders, keeping things organized, and making things happen. 
  Proficiency in English. Swedish is a plus but not a requirement. 
  A degree in computer science or software engineering. Alternatively, a combination of other relevant education (formal or self-taught) and experience. 
 

About Irisity 
At Irisity, we develop video analytics software for the security industry with profound respect for personal integrity and privacy, focusing on detecting suspicious activity rather than exposing personal identity. Our system excels at the automatic detection of unwanted activity, such as intruders at construction sites at night, or people climbing roofs or breaking windows. We focus on detecting and preventing criminal activity without registering the identity of regular citizens. At sensitive installations such as schools, our system anonymizes all individuals to hide their identity, to make sure that the invasion of privacy is kept at a zero level. This way, our system can detect what happens and alert, leading to reduced crime rates and increased safety without any negative effects on personal privacy. 
Irisity AB (publ) is a public company listed at OMX Nasdaq First North, with headquarters in Gothenburg. We currently employ a staff of 90+ people globally in development, sales, support, and finance. Our R&D department consists of a computer vision / machine learning team together with an excellent group of system architects, designers, and software developers.¬†
We are now looking for more skilled, friendly, and passionate people who want to participate in making sure that the camera security industry ends up on the right side of history. 
As a global company, we value diverse, inclusive teams that can contribute to our team success through their unique perspectives and experiences and backgrounds. 
We are looking forward to receiving your application. Selection and interviews will be performed continuously until the position is filled. Read more at www.irisity.com

title: Robotics Programmer
description:
At Tata Technologies we make product development dreams a reality by designing, engineering and validating the products of tomorrow for the world‚Äôs leading manufacturers. Due to our continued growth, we are now recruiting for a Robotics Programmer (ABB / Yamaha) to be based at our customer site in Gothenburg.
The role
We are seeking a highly skilled Robotics Programmer with expertise in ABB and Yamaha robotic systems to support advanced manufacturing processes including laser treatment, glue dispensing, and precision assembly. title: Digital Developer
description:
.

Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future. If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.¬†

Who We Are

Service Market Logistics (SML), part of Volvo Group Trucks Operations, serves all brands and business areas by managing and optimizing service parts availability and distribution to secure customer uptime. Through our operations, we provide world class service focusing on delivery precision, quality, continuous improvement, cost efficiency and synergies delivering value all the way to our customers. We embrace innovation and new technologies and work with environmental care and sustainability at heart. Our footprint consists of 40 distribution centers and 3,800 employees worldwide, and we strive for an innovative and diverse workplace, exercising the Volvo Group values with high focus on Customer Success. We are Proud to Deliver. Making a Difference. For People. Every Day. ¬†

Our goal is to keep society running. Making sure that food gets to the grocery store, hospitals have electricity, and that people can commute to work. We do that by making sure that Volvo Group trucks, engines, buses, and construction equipment keep running uninterrupted all over the world. Together with other talented people from a diversity of backgrounds and with a wide variety of skills we make sure that spare parts are available when they are needed in a sustainable distribution network with thousands of dealerships. We are now looking for one or several Digital Developers to join our Supply Chain Optimisation team!¬†

What you will do? 

The Digital Developer position is part of the SML Supply Chain Optimization (SCO) organization.‚ÄØSCO is the function at Service Market Logistics where we enable customer success through an optimized supply chain from suppliers to customers by balancing service levels, tied-up capital, transport cost and performance. One of the most fun parts of being a part of the SCO team is that we work together with all Truck brands and Business areas. What we do has a direct impact on the satisfaction of our customers. With us, you can push your own professional skills and drive change together with committed people! ¬†

You‚ÄØwill be primarily responsible for the long-term development of the state-of-the-art product, which will maximize value by combining software development skills with supply chain domain knowledge. You will also contribute to the ongoing digitalization with automation solutions on both a smaller and larger scale. Other responsibilities will include ensuring high-quality forecasting of future‚ÄØspare parts demand for Volvo Trucks, Mack Trucks, VCE and Penta. ¬†

To succeed in this role, we believe you have: 

  *  A university Degree in Logistics, Supply Chain Management, Mathematics/Statistics, Computer Science or a related field; or equivalent experience. ¬†
  *  Experience working with logistics in a complex global supply chain ¬†
  *  Strong problem solving, research and analytical skills ¬†
  *  Ability to visualize and tell a story with data that compels stakeholders to understand and take action (PowerBI, etc‚Ä¶). ¬†
  *  Experience in 1 or more scripting languages (Python, R, Java, Apache Spark, etc...) ¬†
  *  Knowledge of relational database query languages (SQL) ¬†
  *  Knowledge of Agile methodology, Microsoft Azure, DevOPs, or software development¬†


Ready for the next move?

Last application date: 15 November 2025



We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.¬†

Who we are and what we believe in¬†
We are committed to shaping the future landscape of efficient, safe, and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents across the group‚Äôs leading brands and entities.

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join Volvo Group. Every day, you will be working with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to be able to leave our society in better shape for the next generation. ‚ÄãWe are passionate about what we do, and we thrive on teamwork. ‚ÄãWe are almost 100,000 people united around the world by a culture of care, inclusiveness, and empowerment.

Simulink models aligned with AUTOSAR architecture and development guidelines
Modular and reusable design ensuring scalability and maintainability
Verified and production-ready generated code through Embedded Coder

title: Embedded Software Developer / Engineer / C++ / Linux
description:
We are building a team of skilled embedded software developers to complement our current services within control systems, data science, and AI, and we are looking for you who want to be part of this journey! About Combine Control Systems Combine Control Systems is at the forefront of engineering and technology, delivering high-quality solutions within embedded systems, control engineering, and software development. We support our clients in taking their products from idea to market with efficiency and quality. As we continue to grow, we seek new colleagues who are passionate about technological innovation and professional development. We offer a stimulating and supportive environment where all team members are encouraged to challenge themselves and each other, working together to solve complex problems. Who are we? Combine Control Systems is a leading supplier of high-quality engineering services within Software Development, Data Science and AI, and Control Systems. We help our customers bring their products to the market on time, at a predictable cost, and high quality. We offer varied challenges at the bleeding edge of technology, an inspiring working environment, and enthusiastic colleagues. We are now looking to strengthen our capabilities within embedded development and take on even more fun and challenging projects, both in-house and at customer sites. We have offices in Lund, Gothenburg, and Link√∂ping.
What can we offer you?
 Exciting assignments, within, for example, the automotive industry or defense.
 The possibility of taking on projects together with, and learning from, our colleagues who are enthusiastic about Control Systems, Data Science and AI.
 The flexibility and familiar atmosphere of a smaller company.
 
Our employees describe their work as dynamic and highly mentally stimulating. They say that they appreciate the opportunity to work with new inspiring tasks and projects and expand their knowledge in a supportive and helpful way.
 
Which skills do you need to join the team? We are looking for you who have some experience working hands-on with development on embedded targets. We believe that you are eager to learn new methods and tools and appreciate working with new technologies. You like having fun and respect and trust your team as much as your own knowledge. Qualifications
 Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Electronics, or related technical field
 Professional experience developing software for embedded Linux environments using modern C++
 Familiarity with version control (e.g., Git), CI/CD pipelines, and agile development
 Proficient¬†in English (both written and spoken), Swedish language skills beneficial but not required
  Desirable Skills Experience with real-time systems, safety-critical applications, or functional safety standards
 Knowledge of scripting languages (such as Python)
 Exposure to build systems (CMake, Make), Docker, or container technologies 
 
Who are you? We belive that you are¬†self-driven and enjoy working in collaborative, multidisciplinary teams. You are a¬†problem-solver with a proactive mindset and a strong eagerness to learn and develop professionally. You value quality, innovation, and continuous improvement in your work, and are committed to fostering a respectful, inclusive, and engaging workplace for all. 
  
If you are passionate about embedded software development and want to be part of a company that supports growth, innovation, and teamwork, we look forward to your application! 
 Welcome to Combine Control Systems!

title: Electronics Hardware Design Engineer
description:

In this position, you will be the Component Owner for key control units such as ECM or Inverter. You will carry full product responsibility over time, ensuring robust design, industrialization, and lifecycle management.

You will be the main contact between customers and suppliers and drive the product development from concept to production. You will be part of a team consisting of Software Component Owners, Architects and experts within System Safety, Cyber Security & EMC.

title: Senior Embedded Software Application Engineer - Thermal Management
description:
"Founded in 1927, the Volvo Group is committed to driving prosperity and shaping the future landscape through sustainable transport, mobility, and infrastructure solutions. By offering trucks, buses, construction equipment, power solutions for marine and industrial applications, financing and services that increase our customers‚Äô uptime and productivity. 

Our headquarters are in Gothenburg, Sweden. Volvo Group shares are listed on Nasdaq Stockholm."

Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future. If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.¬†
About us
You‚Äôll be part of the Cab Climate Software team within the Thermal Management technology stream, focusing on our new electrical architecture. Our team of around 12 engineers brings together diverse backgrounds and a shared passion for sustainable transport, working across all Volvo Group truck brands in a collaborative and innovative-driven environment.
What You Will Do
As an Embedded Software Application Engineer you will develop, test and maintain vehicle application software to secure Customer Success. This role involves close collaboration with system engineers and hardware teams to ensure seamless integration, optimizing performance, reliability, and functionality of the embedded applications within constrained environments.
At Thermal Management, you will contribute to the transformation of our company, the transport industry, and society at large.¬†
Your main responsibilities will be to:
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with stakeholders to find ways to improve quality assurance.
‚Ä¢ Analyze system requirements and write test-cases.
‚Ä¢ Troubleshoot and optimize systems in rigs and vehicles.
‚Ä¢ Drive improvements in development processes and environments.
‚Ä¢ Prototype innovations and proof of concepts.
Who Are You?
Do you dream big? We do too, and we are excited to grow together.¬†
Essential requirements:¬†
‚Ä¢ M.Sc. in Electrical Engineering, Software Engineering, or equivalent.
‚Ä¢ Experience in embedded software development (cab climate preferred).
‚Ä¢ Hands on experience in testing strategies, especially in the context of behavior-driven development (BDD).
‚Ä¢ Strong debugging and problem-solving skills.
‚Ä¢ Proficiency in C++ and Python.
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with CI tools (Jenkins, Bitbucket, Git, Artifactory).
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of CAN/LIN protocols and tools (CANalyzer, CANoe).
Nice to have:
‚Ä¢ A customer-focused and quality-driven mindset.
‚Ä¢ Openness to share knowledge and learn from others.
‚Ä¢ Ability to thrive in a changing environment and challenge the status quo.
What‚Äôs in it for You?
We offer a solid package of compensation and benefits, plus you will enjoy:
‚Ä¢ A global and diverse team of passionate professionals.
‚Ä¢ A collaborative environment where innovation thrives.
‚Ä¢ Opportunities to grow and learn in a rapidly evolving tech landscape.
‚Ä¢ A culture built on Trust, Passion, High Performance, Change, and Customer Success.
‚Ä¢ Flexible work arrangements and a strong focus on work-life balance.
‚Ä¢ Access to modern facilities and services at our Gothenburg site.
Ready for the Next Move?
Are you excited to bring your skills and disruptive ideas to the table? We can‚Äôt wait to hear from you. Apply today!
Contact:
Hiring Manager - Ubaldo Tiberi, ubaldo.tiberi@volvo.com
Talent Acquisition Partner ‚Äì Smita Shree, smita.shree@volvo.com

Who we are and what we believe in¬†
We are committed to shaping the future landscape of efficient, safe, and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents across the group‚Äôs leading brands and entities.
Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join Volvo Group. Every day, you will be working with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to be able to leave our society in better shape for the next generation. ‚ÄãWe are passionate about what we do, and we thrive on teamwork. ‚ÄãWe are almost 100,000 people united around the world by a culture of care, inclusiveness, and empowerment.¬†
Group Trucks Technology are seeking talents to help design sustainable transportation solutions for the future. As part of our team, you‚Äôll help us by engineering exciting next-gen technologies and contribute to projects that determine new, sustainable solutions. Bring your love of developing systems, working collaboratively, and your advanced skills to a place where you can make an impact. Join our design shift that leaves society in good shape for the next generation.

title: Engineering Graduate Program 2026 - System Verification Engineer
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future. If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.


Work with the latest technologies to shape tomorrow's society
Imagine yourself working with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in the transport and infrastructure industry, developing cutting-edge technologies and sustainable transport solutions that will change the future of society.
We are passionate about what we do; we aim for high performance and thrive on teamwork. We are almost 100,000 colleagues united around the world by a culture of care, empowerment, and inclusiveness, where each one of us can give our very best.


Are you ready to join the Engineering Graduate Program?
The Engineering Graduate Program at Volvo Group Trucks Technology is a global 12-month program where you are offered the perfect mix of on-the-job learning and diverse training modules. You will get the chance to use and develop your technical and creative engineering skills, while gaining valuable experience working with real products on real business challenges. During the year you will engage in activities that will help you grow professionally and personally, developing strong communication and collaboration skills. 
Besides your manager, who will guide and support you in your daily job, you will have a supportive network of peer graduates, colleagues across the globe, and senior leaders to help you excel. We hope you will learn as much from us as we will from you.


Shape the Future of Safe & Efficient Driving and Services with Us
About the Team
We support the Volvo Group engineering community with cutting-edge tools, verification methods, and data-driven insights. The Data & Release substream is a dynamic and newly formed organization within Safe & Efficient Driving (SED) at Volvo Group Trucks Technology (GTT). Our Test and Release team is at the forefront of verifying and validating the main ECUs that enable ADAS functionalities‚Äîand beyond. As vehicle functions become increasingly distributed across multiple ECUs, our challenge is to develop new verification frameworks to ensure comprehensive HIL (Hardware-in-the-Loop) and SIL (Software-in-the-Loop) testing for all our end-user functions.


How you will make an impact‚ÄØ
As an Engineering Graduate in the Data & Release, you will:
‚Ä¢  Participate in the verification and validation of ADAS and other vehicle functionalities at both HIL and SIL levels.
‚Ä¢  Contribute to the development of new verification frameworks to ensure full coverage of our Functions.
‚Ä¢  Leverage data-driven approaches to create dashboards that visualize software performance and quality.
‚Ä¢  Automate data collection and analysis tasks, enabling the team to focus on insights and improvements rather than manual data handling.
‚Ä¢  Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive continuous improvement in our verification processes.
‚Ä¢  Gain hands-on experience with state-of-the-art tools and methodologies in a global, innovative environment.
 
We believe that you are driven, curious, and eager to learn. You thrive in a collaborative environment and are passionate about making a difference through technology and data.


You meet the following requirements:‚ÄØ
‚Ä¢  An M.Sc. degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Data Science, Systems and Controls, or a related field.
‚Ä¢  Strong interest and/or experience in verification and validation, especially HIL/SIL testing.
‚Ä¢  Good programming skills (Python, C++, or similar) and familiarity with data analytics tools (e.g., MATLAB, Power BI).
‚Ä¢  A passion for automation and data-driven development.
‚Ä¢  The ability to work in an international context and willingness to travel.


To qualify for the Engineering Graduate Program,‚ÄØyou‚Äôve completed a master‚Äôs degree prior to the start of the‚ÄØprogram but not more than 18 months ago. You should not have more than two years' full-time working experience in the field prior to starting. You also need to be fluent in English, both written and verbal.


What‚Äôs in it for you?
Our Engineering Graduate Program starts in August 2026, and you will be offered a permanent position at Volvo Group Trucks Technology with placement in Sweden, Gothenburg. These are some of the benefits of joining our program:
An opportunity to work with the latest technology. 
An exciting and global working environment with experienced colleagues. 
Possibility to gain international experience through a short-term assignment abroad. 
A competitive salary and permanent position from day one. 
Various workshops and seminars designed to help you grow into your future career at Volvo Group. 
The possibility to shape your own career with endless career opportunities.



The application process
The journey begins! An email confirmation will be sent when you submit your application. After this, it is still possible to update your personal profile by logging into your account. The hiring team will review your application together with the hiring manager. Shortlisted candidates will be contacted with information about the following steps.


Last application date: November 23rd, 2025.


We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

title: Software Lead at Colibrium Additive
description:
Would you like to lead software development for a physical product in a global, cross disciplinary environment?
At Colibrium Additive, part of GE Aerospace, we‚Äôre on a mission to bring the transformative power of additive manufacturing to industries around the world. We‚Äôre now looking for a Software Lead to join our Gothenburg team: A hands-on technical leader who thrives on guiding others, writing great code, and improving complex systems that drive real, physical machines.
In this role, you‚Äôll lead the development of the software and services that power our electron beam‚Äìbased additive manufacturing machines. Our main technologies are C# .NET and Python, with additional components in C++. You‚Äôll work both strategically and operationally: setting direction, supporting your teammates, and ensuring our software is reliable, scalable, and ready for the future. You‚Äôll work in a cross disciplinary, global team where software, hardware, and process expertise come together, offering a unique chance to learn and grow while contributing to cutting-edge additive manufacturing technology. You will dig into existing solutions, understand their logic, and help modernize and extend them. You‚Äôll also take part in 3rd line support and root cause analyses, ensuring that we learn from challenges and strengthen our products over time.

Key responsibilities include:

‚Ä¢ Write clean, efficient, and scalable code in C# and C++, with a focus on geometric data processing and distributed systems.

‚Ä¢ Contribute to software design and ensure that architectural principles are implemented effectively in the codebase.

‚Ä¢ Develop and maintain robust client‚Äìserver communication interfaces, ensuring performance and reliability.

‚Ä¢ Work hands-on in an Agile/Scrum team, translating requirements into practical and maintainable solutions.

‚Ä¢ Collaborate closely with global and other software teams to shape technology roadmaps for our EBM (Electron Beam Melting) software products.

‚Ä¢ Act as a spokesperson for the software team within the global organization, communicating progress, challenges, and future initiatives.

‚Ä¢ Provide technical leadership and guidance to a software development team, helping define and deliver high-quality solutions.

‚Ä¢ Mentor and coach other developers, fostering a culture of technical excellence and continuous improvement.
About You
You have a degree in Computer Science or another relevant education, and probably 3-5 years of professional experience in software development, ideally in a role where you‚Äôve provided both technical and functional leadership. You‚Äôre confident working in C# .NET and you have a solid understanding of the software development lifecycle, including modern practices like Agile, CI/CD, secure coding, scalability, and testing techniques. You communicate fluently in English and enjoy working in international teams. You‚Äôre a strong collaborator with great communication and influencing skills, able to align people and ideas across different disciplines and locations.

Experience from additive manufacturing or other industrial machinery environments is a strong advantage. Experience with C++ and Python is also meritorious. title: Technical Developer - Project Team
description:
Smart Eye is leading the global market for Driver Monitoring Systems, which will soon be a standard component in every car. Monitoring the driver behavior is safety critical both for normal driving as well as for autonomous driving. We are constantly growing and are looking for a number of new Software Developers who want to join our team of highly skilled and passionate engineers.

We are looking for experienced developers!

We provide a high tech working environment in an exciting and expanding business and depending on your skills and interest you can work within a wide range of fields.

You will have great opportunities to personal development, challenges and great fun. You will work with highly talented people and join our spirit of an open, inclusive and creative culture. We believe in true teamwork where everyone is important. You find us in modern premises at J√§rntorget, in the city-centre of Gothenburg, with great access by bus, bike, tram, boat, and car. And on top of that the yummiest coffee in Gothenburg!

Work description

Our project team is responsible for delivering our products to our customers. Work involves development of product customizations, project validation, product integration support as well as other technical customer support.

The customer support is typically towards a customer's engineering team and ranges from questions about how something works to analyses or investigations of how our product behaves given certain data.

The project team develops various tools to facilitate troubleshooting or data analysis for the customer. The team also actively improves different CI pipelines, especially the product release pipeline. It is a friendly and international team where collaboration with our Customer Program Owners, as well as with other development teams within the company, is essential.

Typical product customization would be development of new features, optimizing the software for specific target platforms and environments. The work also involves testing and verification for specific vehicle programs as well as working with our customers to create the best possible user experience.

You will have an active impact of the processes and projects and will work in close cooperation with the other talented team members. Your contribution to how we can meet our customers needs with tomorrow's technology will be of crucial importance.

Reporting to: Group Manager in Automotive Solutions Development
Location: Smart Eye AB, Headquarters (Gothenburg)
‚ÄãMust-have-skills:


 - University degree within Engineering context preferably Computer Science or similar.

 - Good knowledge in C/C++, Python and Linux.

 - Background in software development, preferably within embedded systems.

Good-to-have-skills:


 - Experience in one or more fields of image processing, graphics programming, real time operating systems such as QNX, Integrity or Autosar.

 - Experience of software development and/or system engineering within automotive industry (Tier 1/OEM).

 - Experience of developing software for products related to functional safety and ISO-26262.
 - Experience of customer support.

Who are you?

We welcome all types of personalities and believe in a true mix of people to create a dynamic work environment.


 - Ability to work independently in an environment that changes rapidly.

 - A positive, enthusiastic, open, entrepreneurial attitude and a willingness to work closely with customers.

 - Strong analytical, creative skills. Independent, Self-driven, Thorough, Curious and with a strong interest in new technologies.

 - Communication skills with fluency in both Swedish and English. Other languages are a merit.

Since we are working on a global market there might be opportunities to travel and meet with customers.

Interviews are held on a continuous basis, so we highly recommend that you submit your application at your earliest convenience. Welcome with your application.

Smart Eye is the global leader in Human Insight AI, technology that understands, supports and predicts human behavior in complex environments. Together with our subsidiaries Affectiva and iMotions, we are bridging the gap between humans and machines for a safe and sustainable future. 

Today, our technology is embedded in next-generation vehicles, leading the way towards human-centric mobility through Driver Monitoring Systems and Interior Sensing solutions. Our Research Instruments offer unparalleled insights into automotive, aviation, assistive technology, behavioral science and many more fields. 

Our subsidiary Affectiva is humanizing technology by pioneering Emotion AI, helping companies gain a deeper understanding of how consumers engage with their content, products and services, in automotive, media & entertainment, market research and beyond. 

Our subsidiary iMotions provides the world‚Äôs leading biosensor software platform, that synchronizes data streams in real time from multiple sensors. 

Smart Eye was founded in 1999 and is headquartered in Sweden with offices in the US, UK, Germany, Denmark, Egypt, Japan, Singapore and China. A publicly traded company since 2016, our customers include NASA, Nissan, Boeing, Honeywell, Volvo, GM, BMW, Geely, Harvard University, over 1,300 research organizations around the world, 70% of the world‚Äôs largest advertisers and 28% of the Fortune Global 500 companies. 

Visit www.smarteye.ai for more information.

title: Software Developer
description:
Zenseact is an applied automotive AI company developing world-leading safety software for AD and ADAS. Our technology encompasses every aspect of automation, from sensor fusion, computer vision, and object detection to positioning and actuation, using a combination of rule-based code and deep learning algorithms.
Our software makes a difference.
Using AI-based technology to create the ultimate driver support, we‚Äôre fighting to end car accidents and make roads safe for everyone. Every year, around 1,4 million people die in traffic while approximately 50 million people get injured. Many get disabled as a result of their injury. We can do better. And we could use your help.
One purpose, one product.
We‚Äôre a software company dedicated to revolutionizing car safety. By designing the complete software stack for autonomous driving and advanced driver-assistance systems, we‚Äôre fighting to end car accidents and make roads safe for everyone. That's summarized in our purpose statement: Towards zero. Faster. 
Culture with people at heart
To achieve our mission of saving lives and ending traffic accidents is to go where nobody has before. It requires us to venture into the unknown, pioneering new technology and pushing the frontier of autonomous driving. While there‚Äôs no denying our determination and expertise, we must stand united to succeed. By fostering a culture of support and enablement ‚Äì a place of psychological safety where all of us can thrive ‚Äì everything else will follow. We call this a people-at-heart culture. 
Who are you? 
Strong programming skills within C++, Python, 
AI/Machine Learning/Deep Learning experience.  
Exceptional programming skills with Unity3d, Qt 
Knowledge and experience with OpenCV or OpenGL
Knowledge of Deep Learning Frameworks like PyTorch or TensorFlow is a plus 
Software development experience in one or more general purpose programming languages 
Insight in the automotive industry and knowledge of MISRA C++, ISO26262 and ASIL 
Experience of developing embedded real time applications  
Solid knowledge of systems engineering/architecture  
Secure knowledge within continuous integration and deployment 
Experience from defining, building and testing automated toolchains 
Expert in any ADAS/AD feature 
An enthusiastic person who thrives in an agile working culture 

With the skillset and mindset described you have the chance to contribute to our purpose, to go towards zero. Faster.
We are really excited to welcome candidates with these skills so don't hesitate to take the chance of a lifetime! 
Why join 
When we aim for zero accidents faster, we strive to speed up the transition to safe automation. This is essentially achieved by making cars updatable ‚Äì like a computer or a phone. With regular software updates, a vehicle can be made safer long after its production. By accelerating improvement loops, shortening development cycles, and deploying high-capacity software quickly, we can make cars safer, faster.

title: Product Manager, Kiona
description:
Join Kiona as Product Manager and drive innovation and real impact for customers in our Retail & Refrigeration segment  In this strategic role, you‚Äôll shape the segment‚Äôs future by combining AI, data, and sustainability to deliver smarter, energy-efficient solutions that help retailers and building owners reduce waste and optimize operations. You‚Äôll own the product roadmap across the SaaS lifecycle and use AI to validate concepts faster and enhance workflows. 
 About the role As Product Manager at Kiona, you play a key role in shaping and leading the development of services and features within our SaaS offering. You operate at the intersection of business, customer, and technology, turning insight into action and strategy into measurable results.
You‚Äôll own the product strategy for the segment, ensuring that identified customer needs and business opportunities are turned into scalable SaaS solutions and measurable impact. Together with other Product Managers and the development team, you‚Äôll ensure a unified strategy and turn insights into solutions that drive measurable business results. 
 Your main responsibilities Take full ownership of the SaaS product lifecycle from concept and product strategy to packaging, launch, and continuous optimization. You‚Äôll ensure our SaaS offering evolves into an even more professional, scalable, and value-driven solution, balancing short-term customer needs with long-term product vision.
 Define and communicate the end-to-end product roadmap, from idea to launch and continuous improvement 
 Drive SaaS productification, ensuring that features and services are packaged and delivered as scalable, value-driven offerings
 Identify and validate new service and product opportunities that create customer value
 Leverage AI as a driver of smarter decisions, faster validation, and continuous innovation
 Collaborate with the development team to turn strategy into effective solutions
 Communicate roadmap progress and results across teams to ensure alignment and transparency
 Track feature adoption, measure impact, and deliver measurable business outcomes
 Work cross-functionally with tech, marketing, sales, and customer success
 Own the product‚Äôs business case and contribute to company growth and commercial success
 Act as an ambassador for your product, both internally and externally
 
We‚Äôre looking for someone who has
 A university degree in engineering, business, informatics, or equivalent
 Managing the full product lifecycle in a SaaS environment
 Ability to drive product strategy from idea to delivery and measurable results
 Prioritizing and making decisions based on customer insights and data
 Strong communication skills and the ability to align stakeholders
 Analytical strength and solid business acumen
 Excellent collaboration skills in cross-functional teams
 Fluency in both Swedish and English, written and spoken
 
Meriting experience
 PropTech or Retail/Refrigeration domains
 Using or exploring AI in product development processes
 Scaling SaaS products across multiple markets
 Understanding of system integrations with platforms or hardware
 Monitoring and developing product business cases and commercial outcomes
 
Who you are You thrive in a fast-paced environment where business and technology meet, curious about customer challenges and passionate about solving them. Analytical, communicative, and empathetic, you lead by example from idea to launch and build trust through clarity and collaboration. You navigate complexity with confidence and inspire others through engagement, vision, and clarity.
You are driven by development and want to contribute to shaping services and features that make a real difference for users and society.
What Kiona offers you At Kiona, you get more than a job; you become part of a culture defined by our values: Trust, Curiosity, and Creativity. We trust each other and offer freedom with responsibility. We encourage curiosity and continuous learning, and we believe creativity drives progress. Here, you have space to grow, take ownership, and make an impact while working on solutions that make a real difference for the climate and our customers.
The position is based at Kiona‚Äôs new office in MIMO House, central M√∂lndal, opening in June 2026.
Are you the Product Manager we‚Äôre looking for?¬†  Application Kiona is partnering with We SeeQ in this recruitment. Please apply by answering the questions below and uploading your profile. For questions or further information, contact Lena Wadenby: 0702-943550 / lena.wadenby@weseeq.se.  
About Kiona Kiona is a leading SaaS company with the vision to make a big impact in the fight against climate change by offering the smartest and most cost-effective proptech platform on the market. The company enables building owners and other stakeholders to achieve their financial and sustainability goals through the digitalization of new and old buildings and their heating, cooling, ventilation, and refrigeration systems. With offices in eight markets and 150 colleagues, Kiona currently connects over 55,000 commercial, industrial, residential, and public buildings and 3,000 grocery stores in Europe. Through an innovative platform that monitors, controls, and optimizes both energy use and organizations, Europe's existing buildings can now become part of the solution for the future. For more information, visit our website: www.kiona.com

title: AI Growth Engineer
description:
Ride the AI Wave: Become MindArk‚Äôs AI Growth Engineer!
The AI revolution isn‚Äôt waiting for your graduation. If you‚Äôve completed two years of a technical degree (with top grades in math and physics) and find yourself questioning the value of a traditional diploma in a world about to be upended by AI, this is your moment. 
MindArk ‚Äì the creative force behind Entropia Universe ‚Äì is hiring an AI Growth Engineer in Gothenburg to help market our virtual universe using cutting-edge AI tools. We want brilliant minds like yours on board now to ride the wave of AI transformation with us.
Step off the academic treadmill and into a real-world impact role. 
As our AI Growth Engineer, you‚Äôll apply your technical skills to engineer explosive growth for Entropia Universe. Forget the old marketing playbook ‚Äì you‚Äôll write new rules, using data, code, and creativity to turn bold ideas into global success stories.
This is your chance to work at the crossroads of advanced tech and creative marketing, where marketing is treated as an engineering challenge. You‚Äôll run experiments powered by AI and turn them into real results, helping transform a pioneering virtual world into a global phenomenon.
Why Join MindArk?
‚Ä¢ Accelerated Learning: Work with state-of-the-art AI tools on live projects and level up faster than any classroom can offer.
‚Ä¢ Real Impact: See your ideas drive the growth of Entropia Universe in real time and shape a vibrant online community on a global stage.
‚Ä¢ Ahead of the Curve: Be at the forefront of AI-driven marketing in gaming, outpacing what‚Äôs taught in textbooks and setting trends instead of following them.
We‚Äôre looking for ambitious, creative problem-solvers who refuse to settle for ‚Äúgood enough.‚Äù If you thrive on innovation and want to be ahead of the curve, join us and make your mark now. Don‚Äôt watch the AI revolution from the sidelines ‚Äì become the engineer driving it.
Ready to launch your career and make history? Apply today to join MindArk‚Äôs mission and help us engineer the future of digital marketing. Let‚Äôs ride this wave together.

title: Operations Graduate Program 2026 - Digital Transformation Leader
description:
During 15 intense and exciting months, our Operations Graduate Program will give you a holistic view of our operational and logistic activities, including both the local and global perspective.

You will have a permanent position from day one, with a manager and mentor to support you.‚ÄØYou will experience several local and international on the job-rotations and work on business-critical projects developing your competencies for tomorrow.¬†

Our organization

At Tuve Plant, we are not just building heavy-duty trucks, we are shaping the future of sustainable transportation! Guided by lean manufacturing values, we are proud to be the forefront of innovation, and exciting things are happening all around us. As we embrace industrialization and digitalization, we are pushing the boundaries to create greener, more efficient automotive products. Our internal flows and processes are evolving rapidly with automation and breakthrough technologies are at the heart of our transformation.

This is us, your new team

Welcome to Digitalization & IT team from Tuve! We are a collaborative, curious, and value-oriented group working closely with production, logistics, engineering, and business units to unlock digital potential in a company where change is gradual and budget-conscious decisions are the norm. We value open communication, resilience, and practical innovation over flashy quick wins.

Main activities and responsibilities: 

In this role, you will have the opportunity to explore and shape innovative Industry 4.0 applications, such as IoT, AI, machine learning, and data management, to bring measurable value to production, logistics, and business processes.

You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to map and enhance business processes, conduct value stream mapping and gap analyses, and propose practical, cost-effective solutions. Additionally, you will act as a facilitator of change by engaging stakeholders across different departments to build alignment and foster a digital mindset. You will create and manage small-scale pilots or proof-of-concept projects, from scoping to execution, ensuring that the learnings can be scaled. In parallel, you will contribute to shaping product-oriented digital strategies that thoughtfully balance long-term transformation with immediate operational needs.

Throughout the process, you will communicate progress, challenges, and insights clearly, engaging leadership and leveraging data to support decision-making.

Who are you? 

We are looking for a proactive, entrepreneurial graduate with strong interest in AI and digital transformation. You thrive in environments where patience and resilience are required to drive change, and you are comfortable working with low digital maturity operations while inspiring others with new possibilities.

We believe you bring a strong analytical mindset and a genuine passion for applying data and AI to solve business problems. You are someone who takes initiative, works independently, and drives projects forward despite obstacles. Your ability to navigate uncertainty with adaptability and a clear focus on value creation is one of your strengths.

An inclusive and collaborative attitude, along with strong facilitation skills, are essential to bring stakeholders together effectively. Your curiosity and eagerness to understand the complexities of vehicle manufacturing are key assets. You have strong communication skills and the ability to present complex topics in a simple and understandable manner. Perseverance and resilience are necessary to drive transformation in a slow-changing, budget-conscious environment. You are a creative problem-solver with a practical mindset, balancing innovation with cost constraints. High energy, curiosity, and a drive to learn and grow within a global manufacturing context are important.

Required knowledge:

  *  MSc or BSc with strong academic achievements in Computer Science, Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, Industrial Engineering & Management, Information Technology, or a related field. Specialization in AI/ML, Data Analytics, Digital Transformation, Industrial Digitalization (Industry 4.0), or Smart Manufacturing.
  *  Knowledge of Industry 4.0 concepts (IoT, AI/ML, automation, digital twins).
  *  Familiarity with data analytics tools (PTC tools, Python, R, Power BI, or similar).
  *  Understanding of agile methodologies and product-oriented work.
  *  Ability to perform gap analysis and business process mapping.
  *  Comfort with stakeholder management and cross-functional collaboration.
  *  Maximum two years of previous full-time working experience, prior to or after graduation. Work during studies are not included.
  *  In this truly global program, communication will be in English, hence you need to be fluent in both speaking and writing in Swedish & English.
  *  Valid work or study permit for Sweden, if not a citizen.


Curious, and have some questions?

Manager: Priscila Lovato, +46313278005, priscila.lovato@volvo.com

title: Finance Graduate Program - Business Controller skilled in Digital Tools
description:
"Founded in 1927, the Volvo Group is committed to driving prosperity and shaping the future landscape through sustainable transport, mobility, and infrastructure solutions. By offering trucks, buses, construction equipment, power solutions for marine and industrial applications, financing and services that increase our customers‚Äô uptime and productivity. 

Our headquarters are in Gothenburg, Sweden. Volvo Group shares are listed on Nasdaq Stockholm."

The Finance Graduate Program
If you are up for the challenge of developing our future Finance function and want to be a part of the innovative world of Volvo Group, this is the graduate program for you!‚ÄØ
During 12 intense months, you will get an end-to-end perspective of our Finance functions and how we co-drive the business, both from a local as well as from a Volvo Group perspective. From day one, you will have a permanent role in one of our organizations, where you will play an active role in daily deliveries. In parallel, you will participate in a number of common training weeks with the other Finance graduates throughout the year, do various job rotations to increase your insights of the Volvo Group and last but not least you will grow as a person. Your professional and personal growth will be supported through individual and team development sessions, mentoring, coaching and feedback.¬†
You will take a deep dive into some specific areas of our business, which will help you get a holistic view and build your future career within the Volvo Group. Besides your manager, who will guide and support you in your daily job, you will have a supportive network of peer graduates, colleagues across the globe and senior leaders to help you excel. We hope you will learn as much from us as we will from you!¬†

Our Organization - Volvo Group Digital & IT

Volvo Group Digital & IT is an interesting place to be, especially during periods of change and transformation. We have a clear commitment to enable value creation at scale for the entire Volvo Group. With a new product-centric operating model and digital technologies, we produce digital offerings that are profitable, scalable, and differentiated. At Volvo Group Digital & IT, you will be part of a global and diverse team of highly skilled professionals, who learn continuously and embrace change to stay ahead. ¬†

Your Future Team

Our global Business Control function supports Volvo Group Digital & IT with financial insights that enable sound planning, efficient operations, and informed decision-making. We work closely with colleagues across Digital & IT, Finance, and other functions within the Volvo Group, ensuring a holistic perspective on business performance. In addition, collaboration and knowledge sharing are central to how we operate.

How you will make an impact

As a Business Controller, you play a key role in driving financial excellence and supporting the strategic direction of Volvo Group Digital & IT. You will work with follow-up, planning and estimates of IT cost and deliveries as well as providing proactive financial analysis and advice to management, helping guide decisions that strengthen business results and operational efficiency. Beyond traditional controlling activities, you will contribute to the Volvo Group‚Äôs digital transformation, supporting initiatives within automation, innovation, and advanced analytics that shape the future of how we work.¬†¬†

Who are you?

We are looking for next-generation experts and leaders within the Finance field who want to make a real difference to society. You are passionate about what you do, have a curious mind, and are willing to learn. Just like us, you thrive on teamwork. In this role, you should be able to cooperate with various stakeholders in a multicultural environment.‚ÄØ You have a strategic, long-term mindset and great skills in telling a story based on financial information in a way that is understood and actionable.¬†
Qualifications for this role¬†
  *  BSc or MSc degree in Finance, Business Administration or similar fields. Meritorious if you have read courses in AI, machine learning and deep learning.¬†
  *  Excellent analytical skills as well as visualization and communication skills.
  *  Strong digital literacy, with the ability to quickly adapt to new tools and systems, including AI solutions, and engaged in driving automation through their use.¬† ¬†
  *  Good knowledge Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
  *  Fluency in business English, both spoken and written
  *  Knowledge in Power BI or SAP are a merit
  *  You should not have more than two years of full-time working experience prior to, or after graduation, excluding work during studies.¬†
  *  A valid study or work permit for the country to which you apply (if you are not a citizen)

title: Operations Graduate Program 2026 - Business Controller
description:
"Founded in 1927, the Volvo Group is committed to driving prosperity and shaping the future landscape through sustainable transport, mobility, and infrastructure solutions. By offering trucks, buses, construction equipment, power solutions for marine and industrial applications, financing and services that increase our customers‚Äô uptime and productivity.

If you are up for the challenge of developing our future Operations and want to be a part of the innovative world of Volvo Group, this is the graduate program for you!‚ÄØ‚ÄØ¬†

During 15 intense and exciting months, our Operations Graduate Program will give you a holistic view of our operational and logistic activities, including both the local and global perspective. You will be working with the technologies of tomorrow, building the products of the future ‚Äì electric, connected and automated. In parallel, you will grow as a person, through individual and team development sessions.

You will have a permanent position from day one, with a manager and mentor to support you.‚ÄØYou will experience several local and international on the job-rotations and work on business-critical projects developing your competencies for tomorrow. You will take a deep dive into some specific areas of our business such as manufacturing, health and safety, quality, and continuous improvements, while also learning about the end-to-end supply chain, aftermarket parts and our remanufacturing operations. In addition, you will gather with other program participants to take part in trainings and events designed to help you grow into your future career at the Volvo Group.
We offer the opportunity for you to be part of our digital transformation, applying new technologies to connect and automate our processes. Together we work with AI, data science, machine learning, circular systems, virtual manufacturing and more, to build our full electric or autonomous products.

If‚ÄØrotational development, a‚ÄØglobal set up‚ÄØand designing the world of tomorrow are aspects you are looking for in your‚ÄØnext job context, this position might be something for you.

Our organization 

Tuve Plant, located in Gothenburg at the heart of Volvo, produces premium heavy-duty diesel, gas and electric trucks. Additionally, we produce frame members not only for ourselves but also for Ghent and our knock-down assembly plants. Furthermore, we are the introduction plant for all new models for Volvo Brand, meaning we are first out!

This is us, your new team

Here at Tuve Plant, we are 2800 employees, so come join our Business Controller Team where we manage all financial aspects of the operations.

We deliver on our promises. At Tuve we are a curious team, work with passion and embrace challenges to stay ahead. We work KPI oriented, both in goal setting and follow up.

Main activities and responsibilities: 

As a Business Controller, you will deliver financial support and guidance to our Tuve organization, with the aim of enhancing our business performance. You should be a good storyteller and provide transparent information. You will work with digitalization to optimize existing processes and develop good visualizations for the organization. We focus on continuous improvements, and we hope you will be able to bring new aspects into our way of working.

In addition, you will participate in several common training weeks with the other participants in the program and do various job rotations to broaden your horizon within the Volvo Group.

Who are you? 

To be successful in this role, you bring a reflective and structured approach, along with strong analytical abilities. You have a holistic, end-to-end understanding of business and enjoy working closely with others to create impact.¬†Additionally, you find energy in collaborative environments and are a supportive and engaged team member. Your passion for new technologies and digital tools inspires you to explore innovative ways of working. You are naturally curious, creative, and communicate with clarity and empathy.

 Required knowledge/experience:

  *  BSc or MSc in business administration specialized in business control or accounting.
  *  Knowledge in Lean manufacturing.
  *  Knowledge in BI-tools.
  *  You understand the basics of lean manufacturing and continuous improvement methodologies.
  *  Maximum two years of previous full-time working experience, prior to or after graduation. Work during studies are not included.
  *  In this truly global program, communication will be in English, hence you need to be fluent in both speaking and writing in Swedish and English. ¬†
  *  Valid work permit for Sweden if not a citizen.¬†


Curious, and have some questions? Contact us!

Manager: Olga Landstrom, +46 739022252, olga.landstrom@volvo.com¬†
HRBP: Louise Karlsson, +46 739022252, louise.karlsson.3@volvo.com¬†

Kindly note that due to GDPR, we will not accept applications via mail. Please use our career site.¬†

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

title: Android Platform Architect
description:
Join the Revolution in Commercial Vehicle Tech. At Coretura, we‚Äôre not just building the future of commercial vehicles‚Äîwe‚Äôre redefining how automotive software is developed. As a joint venture between Volvo Group and Daimler Truck, we blend startup speed with industry strength. And we‚Äôve gone all-in on AI.
We‚Äôre looking for an experienced Android Platform Architect to help define and lead the system-level architecture of our Android-based infotainment and vehicle integration stack‚Äîbridging the gap between hardware, middleware, and Android OS internals.
 
What You‚Äôll Do
In this role, you‚Äôll take ownership of the Android platform architecture, working closely with hardware and middleware teams to ensure seamless integration, performance, and compliance. Your responsibilities will include:
 Architecting the Android platform stack from HAL to system services, with a focus on embedded integration.
 Defining HAL/service boundaries and OTA update strategies (including A/B partitioning).
 Collaborating with hardware, AUTOSAR, and middleware teams to align Android with real-time ECUs.
 Leading efforts in secure and scalable system design: SELinux, sandboxing, secure/verified boot.
 Optimizing system performance: boot time, memory footprint, GPU/CPU scheduling.
 Designing for multi-SoC, multi-display, and multi-user environments.
 Ensuring compliance with Google certification (CTS, VTS) and projection standards.
 Guiding Android virtualization strategies (e.g., VirtIO, Cuttlefish).
 Aligning architecture with functional safety standards (ISO-26262, ASPICE, AUTOSAR).
 Acting as a technical interface with OEM stakeholders and certification partners.
 Lead Android certification strategy and compliance processes including projection certification
 
 
What You Bring
At Coretura, we value more than just technical expertise‚Äîwe‚Äôre looking for someone who brings genuine drive, initiative, and a proactive, action-driven mindset to every challenge. You‚Äôre passionate about technology and innovation, and your leadership skills inspire those around you to push boundaries and deliver results. Your ability to take ownership and lead projects forward makes you a catalyst for progress in our team.
Alongside these qualities, you have a strong technical foundation and hands-on experience in Android platform development, particularly in embedded and automotive environments. Ideally, you have:
 Proven experience as an Android System Architect 
 Deep knowledge of AAOS internals: system services, Binder IPC, HAL, and embedded design.
 Strong understanding of Android‚Äôs interaction with hardware and middleware layers.
 Experience with Android bring-up, BSP/kernel integration, and SoC-level architecture.
 Familiarity with automotive protocols (CAN, LIN, SOME/IP) and VHAL design.
 Hands-on experience with Android graphics stack (SurfaceFlinger, HWComposer).
 
Exposure to cloud-native design, edge-cloud orchestration, and telematics is a plus.
 
Why us?
At Coretura, we‚Äôre all about shaking things up in our industry! We believe in empowering our team and creating a culture where innovation thrives. 
When you join us, you won‚Äôt just be another employee; you‚Äôll have the freedom to make decisions that drive our projects and tech forward. We encourage creativity and we know that diverse perspectives are key to solving the tough challenges we face. 
Our focus is on making a real impact, and we prioritize what matters most to deliver value to our customers quickly. With a lean team that‚Äôs always learning and adapting, we‚Äôre ready to evolve with the latest technology and market trends. Come be a part of a workplace where your contributions truly matter!
 
Ready to architect the next generation of Android-powered commercial vehicles?
Apply now and help us build the foundation for the future of transport. Applications will be reviewed continuously.
 
Questions? Dont hesitate to reach out to Sandra.hamdi@coretura.com you have any questions. 
Please note we do not accept any applications via email.

title: Doctoral student in physics-informed machine learning for time-series data
description:
Join us to develop physics-guided and data-driven foundation models for multivariate time series in safety-critical systems such as automotive. You will design predictive and generative models, scale training on real data, and validate in simulation and with industry partners to advance safe, reliable automation.

About us¬†
The Department of Computer Science and Engineering at Chalmers and University of Gothenburg in Sweden employs approximately 300 employees from more than 30 countries. The department is divided into four divisions and is widely recognized for excellent research and education, with activities on two campuses in the city of Gothenburg. Research in the department has a wide span, from theoretical foundations to applied systems development. We provide high quality education at the bachelor's, master's, and graduate levels, offering over 120 courses each year. We also have extensive national and international collaborations with academia, industry and society.

We are announcing a PhD position that is placed at the Computing Science division with Chalmers University of Technology as the employer.¬†

This project is a collaboration between the AIXLab@Chalmers¬†and Volvo Group. At AIXLab, we focus on developing AI solutions that are usable and applicable in real-world settings. We are part of the Computing Science division at the Department of Computer Science and Engineering.

About the research project‚ÄØ¬†
This project advances physics-aware foundation models for time-series data. The primary use case is automotive: predicting vehicle behavior, simulating rare safety-critical scenarios and generating test cases to strengthen validation and reduce physical trials. The techniques are designed to transfer to other domains. You do not need extensive experience with physics-guided modeling; strong interest in time series machine learning and the ambition to learn are what matter most. The results will support safer automation, fewer failure modes, more efficient testing, and lower energy use.

Who we are looking for
The following requirements are mandatory:

‚Ä¢ To qualify as a Doctoral student, you must have a Master's degree (masterexamen) of 120 credits or a Master‚Äôs degree (magisterexamen) of 60 credits* in Computer Science, Electrical engineering, or equivalent.
‚Ä¢ You will need strong written and verbal communication skills in English.
‚Ä¢ Strong machine learning fundamentals (probability, statistics, optimization) and strong interest in time-series modeling and physics-guided machine learning.
‚Ä¢ Proficiency in Python and modern deep learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch).¬†
‚Ä¢ Engineering skills: GPU/cluster training, experiment tracking, data engineering.
‚Ä¢ Ability to formulate research questions, run empirical studies at scale.

*for students with an education earned outside of Sweden, a 4-year Bachelor‚Äôs degree is accepted.¬†

The following experience will strengthen your application:¬†

‚Ä¢ Experience with physics-informed machine learning
‚Ä¢ Background in foundation models for time-series (forecasting, representation learning)
‚Ä¢ Exposure to safety-critical systems, scenario generation, or test coverage for edge cases
‚Ä¢ Experience with academic research and publications

What you will do

‚Ä¢ Take courses at an advanced level within the Graduate school of Computer Science and Engineering
‚Ä¢ Develop your own scientific concepts and communicate the results of your research verbally and in writing

Contract terms¬†¬†

‚Ä¢ The Doctoral student positions are fully funded from start.¬†
‚Ä¢ The position is limited to four years, with the possibility to teach up to 20%, which extends the position to five years.¬†
‚Ä¢ A starting salary of 34,550 SEK per month (valid from May 25, 2025).¬†
‚Ä¢ Doctoral studies require physical presence throughout the entire study period. A valid residence permit must be presented by the study start date; otherwise the admission may be withdrawn.¬†

What we offer¬†

‚Ä¢ As a Doctoral student at Chalmers, you are an employee and enjoy all employee benefits. Read more about‚ÄØ¬†working at Chalmers‚ÄØ¬†and our‚ÄØbenefits‚ÄØfor employees.¬†
‚Ä¢ A dynamic and inspiring working environment in the coastal city of Gothenburg.¬†
‚Ä¢ Read more about Sweden‚Äôs generous parental leave, subsidized day care, free schools, healthcare etc at Move To Gothenburg.¬†

Chalmers is dedicated to improving gender balance and actively works with equality projects, such as the GENIE Initiative for gender equality and excellence. We celebrate diversity and consider equality and inclusion as fundamental aspects of all our activities.¬†

If Swedish is not your native language, Chalmers offers Swedish courses to help you settle in.

Find more general information about doctoral studies at Chalmers here.‚ÄØ¬†

Application procedure¬†
The application should be written in English and attached as PDF-files. Please note the system does not support Zip files.¬†

CV¬†

Personal letter¬†


‚Ä¢ A brief introduction about yourself.¬†
‚Ä¢ A brief motivation as to why you are interested in this position.¬†

Bachelor‚Äôs and, if available, master‚Äôs thesis together with the transcripts.¬†

Use the button at the foot of the page to reach the application form.‚ÄØ¬†

Please note: The applicant is responsible for ensuring that the application is complete. Incomplete applications and applications sent by email will not be considered. Contact details to references will be requested after the interview.¬†

We welcome your application no later than¬†December 1st 2025

For questions, please contact:¬†¬†
Yinan Yu (about the research project)
Email: yinan@chalmers.se

Carl-Johan Seger (about the application process)
Email:¬†secarl@chalmers.se

We look forward to your application!¬†
*** Chalmers declines to consider all offers of further announcement publishing or other types of support for the recruiting process in connection with this position.‚ÄØ***‚ÄØ¬†

Chalmers University of Technology in Gothenburg conducts research and education in technology and natural sciences at a high international level. The university has 3100 employees and 10,000 students, and offers education in engineering, science, shipping and architecture.‚ÄØWith scientific excellence as a basis, Chalmers promotes knowledge and technical solutions for a sustainable world. Through global commitment and entrepreneurship, we foster an innovative spirit, in close collaboration with wider society.¬†
Chalmers was founded in 1829 and has the same motto today as it did then: Avancez ‚Äì forward.

The world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world‚Äôs most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. About Capgemini 
Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation‚ÄØpartner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It delivers end-to-end services and‚ÄØsolutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem.‚ÄØThe Group reported 2024 global revenues of‚ÄØ‚Ç¨22.1 billion.
